translations.translation: that the ultimate end is with your Lord;
And that to your Lord is your returning;
and that the final end is with your Lord,
To your Lord will all things eventually return.
And that the end is only towards your Lord?
And that to your Lord is the End.
And that to your Lord is the goal-
and that the final end is unto thy Lord,
And that thy Lord, He is the goal;
that all things in the end shall return to God;
And that Unto thy Lord is the goal.
that the terminus is toward your Lord,
That to thy Lord is the final Goal;
And that to your Lord (Allah) is the End (Return of everything).
and that the final return is to your Lord,
And that to your Lord is the finality.
And that to your Lord is the finality

[53:42] and that (read wa-anna as a supplement; it is also read wa-inna as the beginning of a new sentence; and the same applies to what comes after it, in which case, according to this second [reading], these [inna statements] no longer form part of the content of all that is ‘in the scrolls’) the ultimate end, the return and the destination after death, is toward your Lord, whereat He will requite them;
(And that thy Lord, He is the goal) to your Lord is the return of all created beings after they die and their destination will be to Him in the Hereafter;

commentaries.author: الجيلاني
commentaries.text:
{ وَ } أيضاً مثبتاً فيهما { أَنَّ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ ٱلْمُنتَهَىٰ } [النجم: 42] أي: منتهى الكل إلى الله
 كما أن مبدأه منه
 إذ ليس وراءه مرمى ومنتهى

commentaries.author: ابن عجيبة
commentaries.text:
يقول الحق جلّ جلاله في بقية ذكر ما في الصُحف الأُولى: { وأنَّ إِلى ربك المنتهى } أي: الانتهاء
 أي: ينتهي إليه الخلق ويرجعون
 إليه كقوله:
[الحج: 48] أو: ينتهي علم العلماء إليه ثم يقفون
 لقوله صلى الله عليه وسلم:
 " لا فكرة في الرب " 
أي: كُنه الذات
